channel.title: Classic sword
channel.description:
Well since i can't think of anything to model i decided to remake one of my older sword's. This time i made it and i tried to have as low as quads as possible(without reducing anything).I also used primitives for a few parts.This will be my final model in meta.
Meta(view1): [img]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/7387/classicswordmeta.png[/img]
Meta(view2): [img]http://img535.imageshack.us/img535/5513/classicswordmeta2.png[/img]
Meta(View3): [img]http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/105/classicswordmeta3.png[/img]
Datmaker: [img]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/3579/classicsworddat.png[/img]
In game: [img]http://img198.imageshack.us/img198/3729/classicswordingame.png[/img]
I would have added detail but i didn't feel like it :p

item.title: Classic sword
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Linksys Mr. Linksys
item.description:
@Mr_Linksys wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:7, topic:332293”][quote author=Mr. Linksys link=topic=428732.msg3148132#msg3148132 date=1268272091]
Lol. I miss the simple days when Metaseq was used. I find it much more… Hmm… Glorifying when you make something with Metaseq because of the sole face that it’s harder to make good objects. And harder to make them look good. In these situations I am the old man without the new whoozywhatsitz. Yet I have wisdom xD
[/quote]
Harder to make a model look good in Metasequoia? That is incorrect. It takes LONGER than in other programs but its incorrect to say ‘harder’

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


THAT was (around) my 3rd model ever made in any program, and was made with Metasequoia. All it takes is a little knowledge of the tools in any program and you can produce results. i.e. a professional in Metasequoia can produce a better model than an amateur modeler with 3DS Max can.
None the less, I do understand where you’re coming from.[/quote]

Lol, well thanks for understanding.

Read full topic

I like this sword. Looks good, but could be smaller ingame.

item.title: Classic sword
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Mr. Linksys:

Lol. I miss the simple days when Metaseq was used. I find it much more… Hmm… Glorifying when you make something with Metaseq because of the sole face that it’s harder to make good objects. And harder to make them look good. In these situations I am the old man without the new whoozywhatsitz. Yet I have wisdom xD

Harder to make a model look good in Metasequoia? That is incorrect. It takes LONGER than in other programs but its incorrect to say ‘harder’

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


THAT was (around) my 3rd model ever made in any program, and was made with Metasequoia. All it takes is a little knowledge of the tools in any program and you can produce results. i.e. a professional in Metasequoia can produce a better model than an amateur modeler with 3DS Max can.
None the less, I do understand where you’re coming from.

Read full topic
